Comment: Hi all. This is a nice game in which black used a defence I'm not familiar in but succeed to win.
Benoni defence. Here the main goal of Black is to break white's center with sac on c5.

"Benko gambit - one of the most well respected gambits against d4. Black's counterplay is very durable compared to many other gambits, in that the queenside pressure can last well into the endgame." - chesscorner.com

!! Trap in which black falls directly. If now 23...fxe6 the checkmate follows after 24.Rh8+ Bxh8 25.Qxh8+ Kd7 26.fxe6# (25...Ng8 26.Qxg8+ Kd7 27.fxe6#) But the right way out is to decline knight sac with 24...Qb6 leaving the dark bishop.
And black resigns. Thanks for watching
